definitions: thin savory liquid made by simmering meat, fish, or vegetables in water
examples: The chicken broth simmered gently on the stove
She added vegetable broth to enhance the soup's flavor

definitions: building where people pay money to have sexual activities with prostitutes
examples: The old brothel was converted into a historical museum
Police raided several illegal brothels in the district

definitions: organization of people united by shared interests, beliefs, or profession
feeling of kinship and mutual support among men or people in general
examples: He joined the brotherhood of firefighters after graduating
The brotherhood meets every month to discuss community projects
The soldiers developed a strong brotherhood during combat
Brotherhood between nations promotes lasting peace and cooperation

definitions: part of face above eyes including the forehead and eyebrows
top edge or projecting upper part of a hill or cliff
examples: She wiped the sweat from her brow after exercising
His furrowed brow showed deep concentration on the problem
We stood at the brow of the hill overlooking the valley
The house perched on the brow offered spectacular views

definitions: square piece of rich chocolate cake typically containing nuts
helpful household sprite or elf in Scottish and English folklore
member of the junior branch of the Girl Scouts organization
examples: She baked a batch of fudge brownies for the party
The warm brownie was served with vanilla ice cream
The brownie was said to clean the house while people slept
Scottish tales tell of brownies helping with farm work
My daughter earned her first badge as a Brownie Scout
The Brownies are selling cookies to fund their camping trip

definitions: process of food becoming brown through cooking, especially by heat exposure
examples: The browning of the meat creates a delicious crust
Careful browning adds rich flavor to the dish

definitions: row house built from brown sandstone, especially common in New York City
examples: They renovated a nineteenth-century brownstone in Brooklyn
The brownstone neighborhood retained its historic character

definitions: act of looking through items casually without specific intent to buy
examples: A quick browse through the bookstore revealed many interesting titles
His browse of the website lasted over an hour

definitions: activity of looking through items, websites, or information in a leisurely way
examples: Her browsing in the antique shop uncovered hidden treasures
Internet browsing has become a popular pastime worldwide

definitions: name for a bear, especially used in stories or as a mascot
examples: The UCLA Bruins use a bear as their team mascot
In the folktale, Bruin was the wisest animal in the forest

definitions: area of discolored skin caused by blood vessels breaking from impact
soft damaged area on fruit or vegetables from impact or pressure
examples: The bruise on her arm turned purple after the fall
He applied ice to reduce swelling around the bruise
The bruise on the apple made it unsuitable for display
Handle peaches carefully to avoid creating bruises

definitions: large strong person, typically one who is aggressive or likes to fight
examples: The bouncer was a real bruiser with massive arms
That bruiser on their team intimidates all the opponents

definitions: late morning meal combining breakfast and lunch, typically eaten on weekends
examples: We enjoyed a leisurely brunch at the new caf√© downtown
The hotel serves an elaborate Sunday brunch with champagne

definitions: man or boy with dark brown or black hair
examples: The tall brunet entered the room with confidence
She preferred dating brunets over blond men

definitions: woman or girl with dark brown or black hair
examples: The brunette actress won the leading role in the film
She dyed her hair to become a brunette

definitions: main force or impact of something unpleasant or harmful
examples: The coastal towns bore the brunt of the hurricane
She took the brunt of her boss's anger

definitions: act of cleaning, grooming, or applying something with a brush
examples: Daily brushing keeps your teeth healthy and clean
The horse enjoyed its morning brushing session

definitions: undergrowth, twigs, and small branches from trees or shrubs
examples: They gathered brushwood to start the campfire
The deer disappeared into the thick brushwood

definitions: way an artist applies paint with a brush, showing their skill and style
examples: The painter's delicate brushwork created realistic textures
Critics praised the bold brushwork in her latest exhibition

definitions: savage physical violence or cruel and harsh behavior toward others
examples: The documentary exposed the brutality of the regime
Police brutality sparked protests across the city

definitions: savagely violent person or one who lacks intelligence or sensitivity
large powerful animal, especially one that is dangerous or difficult to control
examples: That brute attacked innocent people without provocation
He acted like a brute, showing no compassion
The massive brute of a bull charged at the fence
Wrestling that brute of a horse required great strength

definitions: informal term for champagne or other sparkling wine
examples: They popped open the bubbly to celebrate their engagement
Would you prefer red wine or bubbly with dinner?

definitions: pirate, especially one operating in the Caribbean during the 17th and 18th centuries
examples: The buccaneer sailed the Caribbean searching for treasure ships
Stories of buccaneers fascinate children learning about history

definitions: North American tree or shrub with showy flower clusters and large seeds
shiny brown nut from a buckeye tree, resembling a deer's eye
examples: The Ohio buckeye tree bloomed beautifully in spring
Buckeye trees provide shade in many Midwestern parks
Children collected buckeyes believing they brought good luck
The polished buckeye looked like a precious stone

definitions: metal or plastic device with a frame and prong for fastening straps
bend, warp, or collapse under pressure or heat
examples: The belt buckle was made of polished brass
She struggled to fasten the tiny buckle on her shoe
The buckle in the pavement created a dangerous bump
Heat caused a large buckle in the railroad tracks

definitions: small round shield held by a handle or worn on the forearm
examples: The medieval knight carried a buckler for close combat
The museum displayed an ornate buckler from the fifteenth century

definitions: large lead shot used in shotgun shells for hunting big game
examples: The hunter loaded buckshot for deer hunting season
Buckshot spreads widely, making it effective at close range

definitions: soft leather made from the skin of a male deer
horse with a yellowish or tan coat and black mane and tail
examples: Native Americans traditionally made clothing from buckskin
The buckskin jacket was both durable and comfortable
She rode a beautiful buckskin mare in the parade
The buckskin stallion grazed peacefully in the meadow

definitions: shrub or small tree with thorny branches and small black berries
examples: The dense buckthorn hedge provided excellent privacy
Birds nested safely in the thorny buckthorn bushes

definitions: plant cultivated for its grain-like seeds used in flour and as animal feed
examples: Buckwheat pancakes have a distinctive nutty flavor
Farmers planted buckwheat as a cover crop

definitions: small swelling on a plant that develops into a flower or leaf
informal term for buddy or friend, especially in North American usage
examples: The rose bud slowly opened into a beautiful flower
Spring buds appeared on all the trees
Hey bud, want to grab lunch together?
My bud from college visited last weekend

definitions: beginning to develop or show signs of future potential in a skill or career
examples: The budding artist displayed her work at local galleries
His budding romance with Sarah delighted their friends

definitions: small Australian parakeet often kept as a pet, short for budgerigar
examples: Her blue budgie learned to mimic several words
The budgie chirped happily in its spacious cage

definitions: person who is enthusiastically interested in and knowledgeable about a particular subject
soft thick yellowish leather or cloth used for polishing
state of being physically fit with well-defined muscles
examples: The history buff could name every Civil War battle
Film buffs gathered for the classic movie marathon
He used a buff to polish the silver until it gleamed
The buff removed scratches from the car's finish
After months of training, he was in buff condition
The bodybuilder's buff physique impressed the judges

definitions: large bovine animal with massive head and shoulders, found in North America and Asia
examples: A buffalo herd grazed peacefully on the prairie
Native Americans depended on buffalo for food and materials

definitions: person or thing that reduces shock or forms a barrier between incompatible things
temporary storage area for data being transferred between devices or programs
examples: The trees acted as a buffer against the strong winds
She served as a buffer between the arguing coworkers
The video buffer prevented interruptions during streaming
Increasing the buffer size improved download performance

definitions: meal where guests serve themselves from various dishes displayed on a table
repeated violent blows or knocks from wind, waves, or other forces
examples: The wedding buffet offered an impressive variety of dishes
We enjoyed the all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet at the hotel
Strong winds continued to buffet the coastal town
The ship took a buffet from the massive waves

definitions: light horse-drawn vehicle or a wheeled cart for a baby
examples: The Amish family traveled to town in their horse and buggy
She pushed the baby buggy through the park

definitions: brass instrument like a small trumpet, traditionally used for military signals
examples: The soldier played reveille on his bugle at dawn
The hunting bugle echoed through the forest

definitions: person who plays a bugle, especially in the military
examples: The bugler sounded taps at the soldier's funeral
Every morning the bugler woke the camp with reveille

definitions: person whose job is constructing buildings or a company that constructs buildings
examples: The builder completed the house ahead of schedule
We hired a reputable builder for our home renovation

definitions: gradual accumulation or increase of something over a period of time
examples: The military buildup along the border caused international concern
Plaque buildup in arteries can lead to heart disease

definitions: rounded underground storage organ of certain plants that produces new growth
glass container with wire filament that produces light when electricity passes through
examples: Plant tulip bulbs in fall for spring flowers
The garlic bulb separated into individual cloves
The light bulb burned out and needed replacement
LED bulbs use less energy than traditional bulbs

definitions: rounded swelling that sticks out from a surface in an abnormal way
examples: The bulge in his pocket revealed where he kept his wallet
A dangerous bulge appeared in the damaged tire

definitions: serious eating disorder characterized by binge eating followed by purging to avoid weight gain
examples: She sought treatment for bulimia at a specialized clinic
Bulimia can cause serious health complications if left untreated

definitions: large mass or shape of something, especially when heavy or solid
main or greater part of something
examples: The ship's massive bulk dominated the harbor
He struggled to move the bulk of the fallen tree
The bulk of the work was completed by noon
She spent the bulk of her savings on the house

definitions: upright partition separating compartments in a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle
examples: The watertight bulkhead prevented the ship from sinking
Passengers sat near the forward bulkhead of the plane

definitions: medium-sized dog breed with a wrinkled face, pushed-in nose, and muscular body
examples: The English bulldog snored loudly while sleeping
Despite their fierce appearance, bulldogs make gentle family pets

definitions: powerful tractor with a large blade for pushing earth and clearing ground
examples: The bulldozer cleared the land for new construction
Heavy bulldozers removed debris after the earthquake

definitions: short official statement or news report intended for immediate publication or broadcast
examples: The news bulletin interrupted regular programming
She posted the bulletin on the community notice board
